metadata.title: AKS API Server Brute Force
metadata.description: Detects potential brute force attacks against the Kubernetes API server.

properties.displayName: AKS API Server Authentication Failures (Brute Force)
properties.description: Detects multiple authentication failures against the Kubernetes API server from the same source, indicating potential brute force attempts.
properties.query:
let FailureThreshold = 10;
let TimeWindow = 5m;
AzureDiagnostics
| where Category == "kube-audit"
| where TimeGenerated > ago(TimeWindow)
| extend log = parse_json(log_s)
| extend responseStatus = log.responseStatus
| extend sourceIPs = log.sourceIPs
| extend user = log.user
| where responseStatus.code in (401, 403)
| extend
    SourceIP = tostring(sourceIPs[0]),
    Username = tostring(user.username),
    StatusCode = toint(responseStatus.code),
    StatusMessage = tostring(responseStatus.message),
    ClusterName = Resource
| summarize
    FailureCount = count(),
    FirstFailure = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastFailure = max(TimeGenerated),
    UsernamesAttempted = make_set(Username, 50),
    StatusCodes = make_set(StatusCode, 10),
    StatusMessages = make_set(StatusMessage, 10)
    by ClusterName, SourceIP, bin(TimeGenerated, TimeWindow)
| where FailureCount >= FailureThreshold
| extend UniqueUsers = array_length(UsernamesAttempted)
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    ClusterName,
    SourceIP,
    FailureCount,
    UniqueUsers,
    UsernamesAttempted,
    FirstFailure,
    LastFailure

alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat: Detected {{FailureCount}} authentication failures from {{SourceIP}} targeting {{UniqueUsers}} unique accounts.
